intro: Bartsia bicolor, commonly known as the two-color bartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically display a striking two-tone coloration. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are usually slender and branching. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Bartsia bicolor is often found in association with other woodland flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
